page.title: 13ST. LEONARD'S CHURCH, RYTON.
page.content: { St. Leonard's}was built in the late {11th.C.}of red sandstone rubble. The somewhat large crenellated tower was added in the 15th. C. Much{renovation work has been carried out in recent years. For a full account of the church see;{"VICTORIA COUNTY HIST." {VOL.6; PP 210-213. The church is the oldest and most significant building in the area. On approaching Ryton from the south the church is seen at it's best. The church and the new{village hall, over the A45, provide the village with;a{meeting place}for some 15 groups;a dance and bingo hall, as well as being a religious centre. The groups cover a wide range of interests and ages. There are{plans}to use the hall as a Doctors's surgery until a proper one can be set up. The British Legion Club is next to the hall.
